[b][color=white]RKO Is Out the Show[/color][/b] 
[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5671360][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has announced that he has officially removed the plugin allowing him to RKO also going so far as to alter all documentation in regards to RKO as a form of consequence. The last RKO took place only hours before the announcement was made on [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1573931][b]Narrate[/b][/url]. The reason for removing the plugin was due to its inability to communicate policy violations coupled with the lasting damage done to a veteran member's reputation. [size=xx-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5671360]>>Source[/url][/size]

[align=left][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color]As of the Friday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[hr]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ESqIDlp.png[/img]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939] Sejskaler[/url][/font][/size][spoiler][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: I'd like to welcome you to edition 352 of the news, Sejskaler. Let's jump right into the interview.
You first joined HF in 2010. What brought you to HF in its early days?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Back in the days, such a nostalgic thought, back in those days I was super interested in computers and coding, but more hacking, and hackforums was the first thing that came up on google. There's unfortunately not much grandiose about it.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: That's a common start to any story on HF. What's interesting is that you eventually became well-known for your artistic ability on the site. How long after joining did you depart from hacking in order to pursue art?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Oh, that's quite interesting, it took a while actually, I think around half a year? I am not entirely sure actually. It all opened up after I stumbled upon some tutorials, I saw all of these signatures and interesting ideas getting thrown around on the forums. After a while the hacking became a more minor part, and I got more into the graphics, but it took quite a while before art became the main point of my visits. After meeting some great people, I simply ended up staying around, in the end focusing on graphics.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: So would you credit HF as integral part of your journey in becoming a graphic artist? Was there any particular user that inspired you?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Yes, most definetly, essentially it's the place that spawned my interest, and I gained a lot of ideas through it, followed tutorials etc.

For users that inspired me, there was no one in particular on the forums that inspired me, but rather the whole community and its diversity

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: That's fantastic to hear. HF has the power to transform people for the better, and it looks like you are a perfect example of that.
During your time on HF, how did you feel about groups? What did you like and dislike about them? Are there any past or present groups that are particularly special to you?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: It seems so, either for better or worse, but mostly I've seen people go for better

I've been in quite some groups, from AnimeFan to Void, but one that stands out to me was 143. 143 was an outstanding group full of love and amazing people, I'm actually still talking with a lot of them outside of HF. I like the idea of groups, but it seems like it's become in style to monetize them and sell them off later due to rarity. I think that's pretty bad, other than that, I like the idea that people can create groups surrounding a subject without an SF, or even create a special place. 143 was created around helping others, and I found that absolutely fantastic, I had so much fun and met so many amazing people there, all wanting to help in any way, full of joy, that group hit a special place in my heart.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: That group is revered by many for what it accomplished. For those allowed to take part, it must have truly been a pleasure. I would have guessed you to mention a group focused on art, but it's understandable that 143 comes to mind before others. What is your opinion on art-based groups? Outside that, what is your opinion on the overall state of the GFX section of HF?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Ironically, I was actually never accepted to an art-based group, so I can't give too much insight in that regard. But from my perspective I have seen the groups contribute with amazing tutorials and fun projects for people out of the groups too. I remember applying for the graphics masters back in the days, I guess it got me fired to work more.

Well, from the state of the graphics sector, last I saw it was half a year ago, so I can't say much about that. Last I was there though, there was a lot of minimalistic art and trolling around. While the minimalistic art is great, I saw so many low quality contributions, and a lot of 10/10, I'd love to see people criticise and tell what they do right and wrong, to see the people with interest prosper! I hope it's gotten better and the low quality posters are helping out a bit too, and that everyone is working on getting their work better.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: We both met in Riptide. Did you not consider Riptide to be an art-based group?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Oh yes, I forgot all about that, that was still in my inactive days, my bad, my bad, the graphics sector of that group was rather inactive, so I didn't remember it much for the art - atleast in the end.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: That's understandable. You were one of the main contributors to the graphics section in that group, but it was pretty quiet apart from you and the artist Reset.
As far as you talking about your rejection from other groups that focused on art, it's good to hear you used the rejection as inspiration to better yourself. Where many others would quit in the face of adversity, you took it as a challenge. That's admirable.
It's been said before that the GFX section is not in its best state. It's subject to fluctuation in quality like any section. What has changed from the section when you believe it was at its best? Did it receive more moderation to counter trolling? Were people more critical of work? On the topic of people saying "10/10," why do you believe that happens? Are people afraid to critique others?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Well, unfortunately yes. I remember adoring Resets work though, those were great.

I think we should face the challenges and work our way with those to create something new, become better by failing and learning.

Unfortunately yes, the quality is rather low, I can hear it's still the same. 
I believe that when the community was smaller, there wasn't as many harvesting cheap posts there, a lot of people have tried to fix it, but unfortunately it never really worked. There was a period where there was a lot of focus on criticism, that made it possible for a short period to get a couple of good contributers. 

The "10/10" -  I believe that happens due to easy posts, with a less moderated subforum, where you can do something nice, praising a person, you have a great way to gain some posts, right?

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: There is surely room for improvement, and with the help of some notable members in that section, things may change. If issues aren't addressed, they won't be changed, so thank you for taking the time to offer your insight on the section. It is that same honesty we can hope comes to the GFX section in due time.
To wrap up this interview, let's address the elephant in the room: you recently requested closure of your account. Your time on HF has a start and end date. Would you explain why you requested closure of your account? What happened?
Lastly, what final thoughts and feedback would you like to offer to HF? Feel free to offer any shout-outs as well.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: Why, of course, and we can only hope it will change. And no problem, I hope it will get fixed even though I'm closed.

Well, what happened was rather simple, for some reason someone got some really old cookies that could access my account. I got in contact with him and he got mad I took it back and wouldn't like him to scam. I got things worked out, and after half a year of ban, I thought all was good. Turns out I was wrong, and 3 days after the recovery, since I didn't write a date, he had already logged in and changed the gauth.
I got some help from my friends to vouch for me, and we got the account finally closed for good. This will make sure no one gets caught up in any scamming :) Seems like my time is simply over.

I think it's a great site overall, surely with some flaws, but as I am not going to make a long review, I'd say overall, great community, great moderators and some nice concepts. I wish for it to stay open, and I hope the graphics section will get better. 
I would like to give a shoutout to you, of course, Fury.
One for my oldest friend on HF, Plainside - you know who you are.
And of course to all of the 143 members still around, looking at you, Effexion.
As the last words, thank you community, thank you friends and thank you forums, for giving me a great time, for the while it lasted!
Thank you guys, and best of wishes to everyone, with your passion, and with your personal journeys!
Lastly, thank you for picking me for the interview.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][color=#00ffff][b]Night Fury[/b][/color][/url]: It was a pleasure to have you on for an interview. Thank you for joining me for this week's edition of HF News.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=587939][color=#ffffff][b] Sejskaler[/b][/color][/url]: No problem, and thank you for having me.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[color=transparent]     [/color]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 352

posts.message:

[b][color=white]Comics[/color][/b]
They're back, put away those pitchforks. Thank you.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Oldest Homo Sapiens Fossils Discovered[/color][/b] 
Recently, the oldest Homo sapiens fossil we've ever seen has been discovered. These 300,000-year-old fossils were uncovered at an excavation site in Jebel Irhoud, Morocco. The artifacts found include a partial skull and lower jaw belonging to five separate individuals, some stone tools, and a few miscellaneous animal bones. These discoveries show us a period of human evolution we had previously not had any insight into, with the previous oldest Homo sapiens discovered being approximately 200,000 years old. It is thought that these specimen would be able to mostly blend in with modern day humans, save their slightly elongated skulls. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/06/07/health/oldest-homo-sapiens-fossils-found/index.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Gif and Image Written Into the DNA of Bacteria[/color][/b] 
I'm not sure about you all, but I had to do a double take after reading that title. Using the platform Crispr, researchers were able to encode five frames of a galloping horse which can be seen at the top of the source article. Afterward, the team at Harvard was able to retrieve the images by sequencing the DNA. According to Dr. Shipman, "The information is not contained in a single cell, so each individual cell may only see certain bits or pieces of the movie. So what we had to do was reconstruct the whole movie from the different pieces." The team hopes to eventually scale up the amount of data they are able to write. This should only be the beginning. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-40585299]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/vBnTpNT.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Documents Revealed Show Saudi, UAE Back Al-Qaeda, ISIS[/color][/b] 
Qatar has revealed some documents which show Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) supporting al-Qaeda and ISIS terrorists in Yemen. The papers which were leaked out of the Qatari Embassy in Washington show that the Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman and Emirati heir to the throne Mohammed bin Zayed had backed those at the head of ISIS and al-Qaeda operations in Yemen. Deputy US Treasury secretary for terrorism affairs has said, according to the papers, that bin Salman and bin Zayed were in constant contact with the forces in Yemen and those openly known to be linked to the al-Qaeda terrorist group. The US official has also voiced concerns over bin Salman’s links with ISIS without the coordination of those within the White House.  [i][size=x-small][url=http://ifpnews.com/exclusive/documents-show-saudi-uae-back-al-qaeda-isis/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Russia Secretly Moves Border[/color][/b] 
Russia has secretly and quietly moved its border hundreds of meters further into Georgia. Kremlin troops have moved the border sign hundreds of meters into occupied territory in South Ossetia which Georgia’s security agency has called an "illegal" move. "This is a continuation of the illegal process of the so-called borderisation, which not only violates the fundamental rights of local residents but directly damages the security situation," a statement read from the Georgian national security service. Georgia's president, Giorgi Margvelashvili, was also outraged by the move and called for international help to condemn the action. "Georgia will use all diplomatic levers at its disposal to stop the creeping occupation,” he said. After the Soviet War in 1991, South Ossetia broke away as a small rebel state of Georgia. In August 2008, Russia sent in troops to the state, saying it was protecting those from an attack by Georgian forces. The legality behind it is somewhat gray as Russia recognizes South Ossetia as an independent state, and is one of the few states to do so and this was their justification for the move to occupy South Ossetia. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/politics/russia-georgia-border-south-ossetia-move-hundreds-yards-occupied-nato-putin-west-ukraine-a7835756.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]China Bans all LGBT Content Online[/color][/b] 
New regulations which were issued by Bejing will prohibit any portrayals of homosexuality, prostitution, and drug addiction. The China Netcasting Services Association (CNSA) is targeting what they deem to be "abnormal" sexual activity. The new regulation was issued on Friday and demands that online video platforms hire at least three “professional censors”. Companies were ordered to watch all content and remove any content that did not stick to China's new regulations. The move is condemned by many human rights groups as China tightens their censorship. Other online material which was deemed offensive included: damaging the national image, criticizing revolutionary leaders or portraying the supernatural such as “conjuring spirits”. Those that do not follow the strict new regulation face being reported to the police for further investigation. The move comes after the Chinese government banned all representations of similar content on TV in 2016, stating that “No television drama shall show abnormal sexual relationships and behaviours, such as incest, same-sex relationships, sexual perversion, sexual assault, sexual abuse, sexual violence, and so on.” [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/china-gay-online-ban-homosexual-a7818166.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Jvg81mQ.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]California is Facing a Major Battle Over Internet Privacy[/color][/b]
At the point when the Congress voted in March to topple milestone FCC security principles, buyers and support bunches were angered by choice. The FCC decides that was set to go would have constrained internet service providers to get consent from customers before pitching their information to outsiders. The vote appeared to be a bow to the telecom business, with few saving graces for web clients. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/7/15/15966108/california-bill-browser-history-internet-privacy]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Warner Music has Acquired Songkick’s Concert Recommendation App[/color][/b]
Music disclosure and ticketing organization Songkick has grown in the most recent decade, giving nearby show proposals to customers and ticket deals for live occasions far and wide. The organization is currently isolating up some of its benefits, as per Billboard, and is offering its show disclosure components to the Warner Music Group. 
Established in 2007, Songkick built up an application that enables clients to track and set up notifications of live occasions in their general vicinity, based on integrations with their music library and online records with services, for example, Soundcloud, Shazam, and Spotify. The organization likewise gives foundation to specialists to offer tickets straightforwardly to their fans and dodge hawker exchanging, and assets for artisans to showcase themselves. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/7/15/15976408/warner-music-songkicks-concert-recommendation-app]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]SoundCloud Says it is ‘Here to Stay’ Amid Rumors, it is Running out of cash[/color][/b]
Following a tumultuous week at Berlin-based music spilling service SoundCloud, which a week ago laid off 40 percent of its staff abruptly, the organization's central executive has reacted by saying “SoundCloud is here to say.” In a blog post posted to the company’s website, CEO Alex Ljung tried to reassure users and musicians alike that the “music you love on SoundCloud isn’t going away, the music you shared or uploaded isn’t going away, because SoundCloud is not going away.” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/7/15/15976544/soundcloud-here-to-stay-chance-the-rapper-alex-ljung]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Pixelmon, the Pokemon Mod for Minecraft, Has Been Shut Down[/color][/b] 
The most popular Pokemon mod for Minecraft, Pixelmon, has been shut down by Nintendo. The mod has been around for many years, and sadly their parade has ended. During its beginning years, the mod only had 180 Pokemon to capture in the giant free roam world. Now, the game has up to 523 with the addition of many new things like gym battles with other fellow Pokemon fans. Surprisingly enough, the game was in beta for quite some time. It was not until July of this year that the game was fully released. Such a shame considering that Nintendo has taken action on the mod. Many servers have been made specifically for this mod, and many different gamers ranging from casual players to streamers have participated in the course of the Pixelmon Journey. Nintendo took the developers of the mod to court, and the "Pokelawyers" took the victory in this case. Due to the circumstances at hand, the mod must be shut down and never recreated again. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/pixelmon-the-pokemon-mod-for-minecraft-has-been-shut-down/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New Nintendo 3DS Production Ends Worldwide [/color][/b] 
Short lived, but the newest version of the Nintendo 3DS, the New Nintendo 3DS has completely stopped its production all across the globe. The device was launched in Japan and various countries in Europe, but the only time it was released in the United States was through promotional events or theme related skins. For example, the sale of the Mario themed skin and Pikachu skin. These were limited time bundles that sold out fast when released.  The release of this announcement was on the same day that their latest product, the New 2DS XL was released, so it is safe to say that their focus is on getting those devices made. Quite possibly in the future, the same thing might happen for the New 2DS XL where production is eventually stopped. Of course, that usually happens with most old devices so it is really not new information. The Switch remains as one of the most popular Nintendo devices of the current era, selling over 900,000 units the very first month of release in the United States alone. There are still supply shortages across the globe for this device, and Nintendo apologizes saying this may be a problem for the rest of the year. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-nintendo-3ds-production-ends-worldwide-update/1100-6451647/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Pokemon Sun and Moon Players Can Get a Free Rare Pokemon[/color][/b] 
The chance to finally get a shiny Tapu Koko is finally here! Originally region locked for Japan only, Nintendo has kindly opened the door to the United States, Europe, and Australia so now they have access to the legendary rare Pokemon, shiny Tapu Koko. This is not any ordinary shiny. You cannot get it in the wild, so the only way to obtain one is from this event alone, which is why you do not want to miss out on it. Before, the only way to get it, of course, was to be a Japanese resident or hack it into the game. Now you have the chance to get it legitimately, and your rare Pokemon comes with four awesome abilities. When getting the Pokemon from the deliveryman, you will receive a level 60 shiny Tapu Koko with an Electric Seed item and Electric Surge ability. Simultaneously, it will come with Nature's Madness, Discharge, Agility, and lastly the Electro Ball ability. No code is needed to get the Pokemon, and it is fairly simple to get. All you need to do is go to your Mystery Gift option before starting the game and loading your save. From there, you want to select the received gift via the Internet option. After that, it will take a few seconds to get the notification that you received a gift from Nintendo and then from there; you can claim your new Pokemon! Lastly, head over to any PokeCenter your heart desires and look for the delivery man next to Nurse Joy. He will be wearing an orange shirt with blue stripes and a pair of blue cargo shorts. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-sun-and-moon-players-can-get-a-free-rare-p/1100-6451674/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Overwatch PTR Has a Major Buff for Zarya's Graviton Surge[/color][/b] 
New changes will be coming to some of the heroes in Overwatch soon enough. Some of the names include are McCree, Doomfist, and Reinhardt. One of the biggest names in the list, however, is Zarya. She will be getting a buff to her ultimate ability, Graviton Surge. The original version of the ult will still be there where it will suck in all enemies that are in the range of the vortex, but an additional feature will be added onto that. That feature being disabled movements. Not only will you be sucked into the vortex, but there's no way of getting out. Those in the range of it will be unable to escape from it. The big tank we all love, Reinhardt will be swinging up a fight a lot more! His hammer swing speed has been increased by 10 percent. Additionally, small tweaks on his character model and the swing animation have been smoothed down a little to be designed to look better when swinging, as well as making contact with enemies. The last tweak for Reinhardt specifically will be no more collision damage to him when he slams his foe into the wall. Before, if there were someone else charging into him, Reinhardt would take damage too. Only the enemy will take damage now. Introducing the new hero, Doomfist. He's been packing a punch lately, and that has to stop. His Rocket Punch travel distance has been reduced and will now only travel 21 meters fully charged as opposed to the original 30 meters. Last but not least, McCree and Reaper will be getting a few tweaks as well. For McCree, whenever you hit an opposing player with a flashbang, they will be slowed down too when stunned. Lastly, Reaper will now no longer shout an audio cue as loudly as before when he uses his Shadow Step ability, putting the surprise in a surprise attack. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/overwatch-ptr-has-a-major-buff-for-zaryas-graviton-surge/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wL_MB70WkNc[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ctcHVCW.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Over 14 Million Verizon Customers' Data Exposed On Unprotected AWS Server[/color][/b] 
Data leaks are never a good thing and for a company as big as Verizon, especially if it was by accident. Over 14 million US customers have had their personal information exposed on the internet. The cause of this was due to the fact that Verizon's partner, NICE systems, accidentally left the details of these customers on an open server. The files were uploaded to a cloud. Anyone who had access to it had the chance to download whatever was in the cloud. In addition, the cloud was accessible to the public which makes it 100% worse than it already is. The information that was exposed includes user data like names, phone numbers, and even the PIN numbers. [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/07/over-14-million-verizon-customers-data.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New Ransomware Threatens to Send Your Internet History & Private Pics to All Your Friends[/color][/b] 
The annoying malware known as ransomware has a brand new "strain" spreading across the Google Play Store. The name of this new malware is called LeakerLocker and targets Android phones. When you think of ransomware, you think of your computer or phone is encrypted until you paid the price to unlock it. Well, this virus is a little different. Instead of doing that, it collects all your photos, phone messages, and browsing history on your phone. If you don't pay the hacker that happened to get access to your phone, then they have the option to send all your information to those on your contact list. The price of this ransom is a lot smaller than WannaCry and Petya ransomware and a small price of around $50. Security researchers at McAfee have been looking into the virus and have announced that they have found this petty virus in two different apps they looked into. McAfee suggests that you stay away from downloading any phone cleaner or wallpaper downloading applications. Once activated, the malware will load a malicious code that will send everything to the control server. If you are unlucky to get this, you will receive a message pop up on your phone saying, "All personal data from your smartphone has been transferred to our secure cloud. In less than 72 hours this data will be sent to every person on your telephone and email contacts list. To abort this action you have to pay a modest ransom of $50 (£38). Please note that there is no way to delete your data from our secure but paying for them. Powering off or even damaging your smartphone won't affect your data in the cloud." [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/07/leakerlocker-android-ransomware.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Researcher Claims Samsung's Tizen OS is Poorly Programmed; Contains 27,000 Bugs![/color][/b] 
A Russian team that specializes in program verification systems shockingly state that Samsung's Tizen operating system has over 27,000 bugs. Tizen is used globally and runs on over a million different Samsung products. With that many bugs allows someone with malicious intent to spend their time looking at any vulnerabilities that the operating system might have. Never a good thing. However, for security measures that are good, possibly. Those unaware of what Tizen is, well, it is a Linux-based operating system that is open source. The operating system has been in development since early 2012 and is currently being supported by Intel and Samsung Electronics. Installed in different devices like smartphones, tablets, smart TVs, and so much more. Andrey Karpov, who happens to be the founder of the Russian team that looked over the code of the operating system say that nearly the entire project has errors in the code. More specifically, inside the 72.5 million line source code. Yeah, that is a lot. The operating system has not received many kind reviews, and an Israeli researcher named Amihai Neiderman called Tizen "the worst code I've ever seen", which is undeniably funny. Over 10 million Samsung products are soon due to be released with the Tizen operating system. Quite possibly they should focus more on their security rather than their production. [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/07/samsung-tizen-os-security.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
